description: Change of use of first floor from function hall to a religious meeting place
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | The vertical illuminance of any lighting at the nearest affected fatade shall be controlled to a maximum of 10 lux at ground floor level and 5 lux at first floor level and the main beam angle of all lights shall not exceed 70 degrees.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | The areas shown on the approved plans as parking, access, loading,  unloading and manoeuvring shall be kept clear at all times and used for these purposes only. 	 REASON:	To ensure that adequate parking and servicing space is available within the site. | Details shall be submitted for approval to the Local Planning Authority before the use commences demonstrating measures to be taken to ensure that the composite sound reduction index of the building envelope, RM is not less than 40 dB averaged over the frequency range 100 to 3150 Hz, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided. The approved measures shall be installed before commencement of the use and thereafter retained permanently.  REASON:	In the interests of the amenity of nearby residents. | Details shall be submitted for approval before commencement of the use, for suitable mechanical ventilation measures, to ensure that doors and windows are kept closed during hot weather  and the plant associated with this system will be silenced to a standard not exceeding {NR35 Leq (5 mins), 2300 to 0700 hrs measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises. The approved measures shall be installed before commencement of the use and thereafter retained permanently.  REASON:	In the interests of the amenity of nearby residents. | Details shall be submitted for approval before commencement of the use, for suitable sound limiting device to control the output from the amplification system to level agreed with the Local Planning Authority. The limiter device shall be connected to all external doors so that the power to amplifiers will be cut off if a door is opened, other than for means of escape from fire. The approved device shall be installed before commencement of the use and thereafter retained permanently.  REASON:	In the interests of the amenity of nearby residents. | Details shall be submitted for approval in writing to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises shall be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR35 Leq (5 mins) 2300 to 0700 hrs weekdays and any time on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays and NR 40Leq. 1hr for plants which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700 - 2300hrs Mondays to Fridays measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together. The approved measures shall be installed before commencement of the use and thereafter retained permanently.  REASON:	In the interests of the amenity of nearby residents. | The hours of operation of the use hereby permitted shall be limited to between 8:00hrs and 22:00 hrs on any day of the week.  REASON:	In the interests of the amenity of nearby residents. | The use granted shall be personal to UCKG Helpcentre only and shall not enure for the benefit of the land, or any other person or company without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  If after the development has been carried out UCKG Helpcentre ceases to be the occupier of the land the use shall be discontinued.  REASON: Permission has been granted in view of the  personal circumstances of the applicant which otherwise may not be appropriate.
